definition: to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)

sentences.english: Business is possible if you ca fantastic lower the price to HK$2150.
sentences.chinese: 你方若能削價到2150港幣，或者成交。

sentences.english: The store discounted all computers for the sale.
sentences.chinese: 該店削價出售全部待售的電腦。

sentences.english: No discount for these off-price merchandise.
We assume no remainders in this model.
sentences.chinese: 我們假設這模型中沒有削價出售。
這些橡皮在削價出售嗎？

sentences.english: It simply can't stand such a big cut.
sentences.chinese: 哪能經得住這麼大的削價。

sentences.english: We happen to have some shirts on sale today.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天正巧有襯衫削價處理。

sentences.english: You know that some countries are selling this kind of products at cheap prices in large quantities.
sentences.chinese: 您知道有的國家對這種商品正在削價拋售。
這些綠短褲大削價，每條25元。

sentences.english: I understand some countries are actual ly lowering their prices.
sentences.chinese: 我知道有的國家實際上正在削價拋售。

sentences.english: We have to cheapen commodities at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 目前我們只好使商品削價。

sentences.english: The unsalable books are to be remaindered next week.
sentences.chinese: 滯銷書將於下週削價出售。
